ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: As a result of this course, I was able to have interesting conversations with my classmates and friends, both inside and outside the classroom. I have become more tolerant of different ideas and worldviews, and I think that's a useful skill to have when engaging in discussions, debates, and negotiations. Because of this course, I sometimes surprise myself with the ideas my peers and I come up with, and it's interesting to see what our discussions lead to, even if they can get quite heated sometimes (we still stay respectful and are still great friends!)!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think this was a wonderful course overall. I enjoyed learning about worldviews and disagreements (both of facts and of values). I especially treasured my visit to the Yale Art Gallery; I saw lots of wonderful art there, and choosing my favorite was a real challenge! And of course, the discussion on Drug Control we had in our last class; that was one of the most interesting yet intellectually, morally, and emotionally challenging things I have ever done in my entire life, as both groups presented really strong points that were difficult to defend against - partially because Drug Control itself is a tough, multifactorial problem.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.

extras.title: SUMR S010D 01 - Critical and Creative Thinking
